title: Designing Flexible Learning Strategies Based on University Students' English Learning Experiences During COVID-19

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic online learning tools and elementary English education experience
context.additional_context: A process where elementary school teachers analyze university students' English learning cases during COVID-19 to develop flexible learning strategies, focusing on blended offline/online tasks in a digital device-provided environment.

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more self-directed English learning strategies across diverse learning environments
Learners can develop collaborative task models applicable in offline/online environments using the PBL approach
Learners can propose alternative learning solutions considering technology accessibility constraints (internet connectivity, device shortages)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
